thread.title: SpiceRoads Launches New Road Biking Tour in Northeast Thailand
thread.title_full: SpiceRoads Launches New Road Biking Tour in Northeast Thailand

author: SpiceRoads Co., Ltd
title: SpiceRoads Launches New Road Biking Tour in Northeast Thailand
text: RSS Feeds: SpiceRoads Launches New Road Biking Tour in Northeast Thailand Take in local life while cycling along roads along the mighty Mekong River, a river that forms a natural border between Laos and Thailand. Bangkok, Thailand, October 15, 2015 --( PR.com )-- SpiceRoads Cycle Tours introduces Mighty Mekong River by Road Bike tour, a new 8-day adventure which journeys along the longest river in Southeast Asia. This tour offers gentle undulating hills to cycle, continuous river views to get lost in and charming towns and villages to explore along the way.“This tour is perfect for those who want to discover rustic Thailand. It is a beautiful area and not visited by many tourists. The roads are good, gently rolling and a perfect place to explore on a road bike,” says Struan Robertson, CEO of SpiceRoads Cycle ToursHighlights:- Cycle along the Mekong River and stay in small riverside guesthouses- See authentic Thailand, including the enchanting town of Chiang Khan- Visit the bizarre giant concrete statues at Sala KeokuGo the distance:This 8-day tour includes 6 days of cycling from 80 km to 150 km per day clocking up a total of 694 kms. The tour is 100% on tarmac and has been designed with road bikers in mind. A support van follows behind the group carrying cold drinks, snacks and is available for anyone in need of a break.2016 departures:
